meanings.sent1: She nixed the idea of going to the park.
meanings.sent2: The teacher nixed the students' request for extra recess.
meanings.sent3: The cat nixed the idea of taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The rain nixed our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: His strict diet nixed any chance of having dessert.

meanings.definition: To put an end to something
meanings.sent1: The loud noise nixed our peaceful afternoon nap.
meanings.sent2: The referee nixed the game due to bad weather.
meanings.sent3: The broken alarm clock nixed any hope of waking up on time.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected guest nixed their quiet evening at home.
meanings.sent5: The sudden power outage nixed their movie night plans.
